html: Allowing lifetime caps means that people will run out of coverage and be deemed too sick to cover. Insurance rates for women go up — we are not a pre-existing condition. 2/2
text:
Allowing lifetime caps means that people will run out of coverage and be deemed too sick to cover. 

Insurance rates for women go up — we are not a pre-existing condition. 2/2

html: The proposals offered by my Republican colleagues provide much LESS coverage than the ACA and here’s how: 1/2 Requiring insurance companies to cover pre-existing conditions is meaningless if you allow the insurer to charge whatever they want.https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/20/us/politics/pre-existing-conditions-trump-administration.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share …

html: As we review the #MuellerReport, I'll share takeaways on this thread. Some key reminders from this page: 1. Congress has a constitutional duty to be a check and balance. 2. Congress has a duty to protect the integrity of the administration of justice. 3. No one is above the law.pic.twitter.com/jTAVBingek
text:
As we review the #MuellerReport, I'll share takeaways on this thread. Some key reminders from this page:

1. Congress has a constitutional duty to be a check and balance.
2. Congress has a duty to protect the integrity of the administration of justice.

It's an honor to be part of this commemoration for those who like @repjohnlewis courageously marched at Selma. Fifty-four years later, we recognize that America is a work in progress, and that each of us has a responsibility to carry on the marchers' work.

html: In addition to Elana being separated from her daughters, we saw dozens of women and children in holding cells, sleeping side by side on benches and cement floors with no room to walk between their bodies, no windows, and no place for the children to play.
text: In addition to Elana being separated from her daughters, we saw dozens of women and children in holding cells, sleeping side by side on benches and cement floors with no room to walk between their bodies, no windows, and no place for the children to play.

html: Her older daughter was withdrawn. It was easy to see how conflicted she was, her feelings of abandonment when she told us that her mother had missed her 5th birthday the week before, and her struggle to reconcile the attachment she had formed to her foster family.
text: Her older daughter was withdrawn. It was easy to see how conflicted she was, her feelings of abandonment when she told us that her mother had missed her 5th birthday the week before, and her struggle to reconcile the attachment she had formed to her foster family.

html: Elana described how much of a toll being separated from her little girls has had on her, but she didn’t have to. We could see it in her face, in her tears, and in the way she and her younger daughter clung to each other.
text: Elana described how much of a toll being separated from her little girls has had on her, but she didn’t have to. We could see it in her face, in her tears, and in the way she and her younger daughter clung to each other.

html: With a lot of luck and the assistance of pro bono lawyers, she was released and reunited with the girls after four months, just a few hours before we met her.
text: With a lot of luck and the assistance of pro bono lawyers, she was released and reunited with the girls after four months, just a few hours before we met her.

html: No reason was given for this separation, as Elana has no criminal record and has never been accused of child endangerment. Yet, it took days for her to make contact with her daughters through a social worker.
text: No reason was given for this separation, as Elana has no criminal record and has never been accused of child endangerment. Yet, it took days for her to make contact with her daughters through a social worker.

html: So, in October, Elana walked across the border with her daughters and requested asylum. Despite the Trump administration’s claim that it reversed its family separation policy in June, Elana’s daughters were taken from her and placed in foster care.
text: So, in October, Elana walked across the border with her daughters and requested asylum. Despite the Trump administration’s claim that it reversed its family separation policy in June, Elana’s daughters were taken from her and placed in foster care.

html: Under our current immigration laws, asylum is the only legal path of entry for Elana. A visa application could take decades, leaving her a terrible choice: raising her American daughters amidst dangers in Guatemala or trying to reenter the U.S. illegally with the girls.
text: Under our current immigration laws, asylum is the only legal path of entry for Elana. A visa application could take decades, leaving her a terrible choice: raising her American daughters amidst dangers in Guatemala or trying to reenter the U.S. illegally with the girls.

html: Elana is from Guatemala, but her daughters were born here in the U.S. and are American citizens. Elana had returned to Guatemala for family reasons but found conditions too harsh to raise her girls. Fearing for their safety, she decided to return to the U.S..
text: Elana is from Guatemala, but her daughters were born here in the U.S. and are American citizens. Elana had returned to Guatemala for family reasons but found conditions too harsh to raise her girls. Fearing for their safety, she decided to return to the U.S..

html: On a recent trip to our border, agents told us about refugees walking up to their cars and knocking on car windows to request asylum. We met one of those refugees. Change is here.

html: Q: What are your thoughts on the GND and why won’t you sign on right now? A: I’m committed to working on this issue & eager to see how the GND evolves. I’m concerned about the “just transition plan” for families in our district and low-income seniors this plan might impact.
text:
Q: What are your thoughts on the GND and why won’t you sign on right now? 

A: I’m committed to working on this issue & eager to see how the GND evolves. I’m concerned about the “just transition plan” for families in our district and low-income seniors this plan might impact.

html: I am very proud of my F from the NRA. We must pass common sense gun legislation.
text: I am very proud of my F from the NRA. We must pass common sense gun legislation.

html: Q: What will you do to support unions? A: It is beyond dispute that unions built our middle class. We need to support the rights of our unions and their right to collective bargain.
text:
Q: What will you do to support unions? 

A: It is beyond dispute that unions built our middle class. We need to support the rights of our unions and their right to collective bargain.

html: Q: Can we overturn this fake national emergency? A: We sent a letter to the President asking for him share the evidence with the @HouseJudiciary. I’ve also cosponsored legislation to undo this declaration. This declaration was a gross abuse of power.
text:
Q: Can we overturn this fake national emergency? 

A: We sent a letter to the President asking for him share the evidence with the @HouseJudiciary. I’ve also cosponsored legislation to undo this declaration. This declaration was a gross abuse of power.

html: Q: What can we do about #GunViolence? A: If there is a national emergency in this country right now it is gun violence. It is our obligation to work on and pass common sense gun legislation. This is a true public health crisis.
text:
Q: What can we do about #GunViolence? 

A: If there is a national emergency in this country right now it is gun violence. It is our obligation to work on and pass common sense gun legislation. This is a true public health crisis.

html: A: We also need to invest in vocational education and making sure that there are various viable pathways to employment for our students. 2/2
text: A: We also need to invest in vocational education and making sure that there are various viable pathways to employment for our students. 2/2

html: Q: What are we going to do about student loans? A: We need to work on policy that addresses the issues contributing to this crisis, like predatory lending, high interest rates, and more. We need to make ed. affordable and accessible. 1/2
text:
Q: What are we going to do about student loans? 

A: We need to work on policy that addresses the issues contributing to this crisis, like predatory lending, high interest rates, and more. We need to make ed. affordable and accessible. 1/2

html: Q: What are your thoughts on healthcare reform especially medicare for all? A: We need to figure out a pathway to universal healthcare and I am committed to working on this incredibly important issue.
text:
Q: What are your thoughts on healthcare reform especially medicare for all? 

A: We need to figure out a pathway to universal healthcare and I am committed to working on this incredibly important issue.

html: Q: What are your thoughts on DACA and immigration reform? A: We need to reform our broken immigration system — we must do that with humane and rational policy. We cannot continue to demonize our immigration system.
text:
Q: What are your thoughts on DACA and immigration reform? 

A: We need to reform our broken immigration system — we must do that with humane and rational policy. We cannot continue to demonize our immigration system.

html: Q: How has this diverse Congress impacted the way things are done? A: When you bring diverse voices to the table that is when you are able to make decisions that are more reflective of the country.
text:
Q: How has this diverse Congress impacted the way things are done? 

A: When you bring diverse voices to the table that is when you are able to make decisions that are more reflective of the country.

html: Q: What was it like to set up an office in such a short amount of time? A: It’s like running a small business. You have to take charge of building out a team that will help you serve your constituents, in DC and in the district.
text:

A: It’s like running a small business. You have to take charge of building out a team that will help you serve your constituents, in DC and in the district.

html: Exactly one year ago, to the minute at around 7am, I sent two kids to school. Only my son Jesse came home. Jaime was murdered in school. #EnoughIsEnough #EndGunViolence #ActionOnGunViolence

html: I’ve always drawn inspiration from what Dr. King called life’s most persistent and urgent question: "What are you doing for others?" Let’s honor his legacy by standing up for what is right in our communities and taking steps to make a positive impact on the world.
text: I’ve always drawn inspiration from what Dr. King called life’s most persistent and urgent question: "What are you doing for others?" Let’s honor his legacy by standing up for what is right in our communities and taking steps to make a positive impact on the world.

html: We’ve seen those whose voices have been ignored put their name on the ballot. We’ve seen the rebirth of civic resolve. We must keep a steady pulse on progress. We mobilize. We march. We speak up. And sometimes, we even run. We must keep moving. We must keep going.
text: We’ve seen those whose voices have been ignored put their name on the ballot. We’ve seen the rebirth of civic resolve. We must keep a steady pulse on progress. We mobilize. We march. We speak up. And sometimes, we even run. We must keep moving. We must keep going.

html: What gives me hope is that we continue to see Dr. King’s lessons, spirit, and commitment to justice, reincarnated. We have seen those who were complacent become activists, those who questioned the value of voting - organize others to vote.
text: What gives me hope is that we continue to see Dr. King’s lessons, spirit, and commitment to justice, reincarnated. We have seen those who were complacent become activists, those who questioned the value of voting - organize others to vote.

html: The resilience and courage of ordinary people remains steadfast against hatred; against fear. Too often, it takes the ground shifting beneath us for us to realize both our power and obligation to demand better for this generation and the generations that follow.

What I fear is that this administration and our Republican colleagues in the Senate have forgotten is this: 

This is the people’s house. We have an obligation to work for them. Refusing to uphold that commitment, that promise, is a slap in the face to the American people.

html: "They know that it is unusual for us to stay home as much as we have been, and for neighbors to bring us food. I am thankful for supportive friends and family."

html: "We are a single income family at the moment and not knowing when we will be paid again has put undue strain on our family. I try not to let my children feel the fear I feel, but they know that something is wrong, kids pick up on these things."
text: "We are a single income family at the moment and not knowing when we will be paid again has put undue strain on our family. I try not to let my children feel the fear I feel, but they know that something is wrong, kids pick up on these things."

html: "At the same time trying to make sure my children's holiday was just as special as when their father is home. Deployments are always stressful, kids get sick, life moves on, but this one has been made harder by this shutdown."
